description: APPLICATION FOR A LAWFUL DEVELOPMENT CERTIFICATE FOR THE PROPOSED ERECTION OF A REAR ROOF EXTENSION; 3 FRONT ROOFLIGHTS; ERECTION OF AN OUTBUILDING
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The operations, pertaining to the proposed roof extension, would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class B of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class B. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 2 - The operations, pertaining to the proposed front rooflights, would consist of any other alteration to the roof of the dwelling house within the meaning of Class C of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class C. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 3 - The operations, pertaining to the proposed outbuilding, would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class E of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in Class E. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 4 - You are advised to complete the roof extension in full accordance with the plans which state 'All proposed materials are to be similar in appearance to
that of the existing house', as, if the development does not adhere to Class B of the GPDO, a breach of planning control could result.

Condition : 5 - The applicant should be aware that the site may provide a useful habitat for swifts. Swifts are currently in decline in the UK and in order to encourage and improve the conservation of swifts the applicant is advised to consider the installation of a swift nesting box/bricks on the site.
